title: Add anti-impersonation guardrails, remove _COIN suffix, and eliminate crypto jargon

requirements.text: Add anti-impersonation guardrails during profile creation so users must explicitly claim the name they are using, and the system reduces obvious impersonation risks without relying on external identity providers.

quotes: we need ways to ensure it is really their name and not someone else.

acceptanceCriteria: During first-time profile setup, the user must complete an explicit name-claim step (e.g., checkbox + short statement) before profile creation can be submitted.
Backend persists additional profile metadata needed for name-claim/verification status (e.g., a claimed-name confirmation flag and any supporting fields added by this change).

Backend enforces at least one concrete anti-impersonation rule at write time (for example: claimed display name uniqueness across all users, or preventing claimed-name changes after initial creation), returning a clear error message when violated.
UI surfaces the userâ€™s current name-claim/verification status in the authenticated area (e.g., in the profile section) in plain English.
No user-facing text in this flow uses crypto terminology (e.g., â€œmintâ€, â€œtokenâ€, â€œcoinâ€, â€œwalletâ€, â€œmoonâ€, â€œpumpâ€, â€œairdropsâ€).

requirements.text: Update backend-generated strings/metadata related to per-user assets so they also avoid crypto jargon and do not include crypto-themed phrases or emojis.

quotes: This should not seem like its crypto so dont use any crypto jargon

acceptanceCriteria: Backend no longer sets per-user asset `name`/`description` fields using crypto-themed terms (examples currently present include: `" Coin"` suffix and `"The ultimate meme asset ğŸ’ğŸš€"`).
Backend changes do not break existing queries/mutations used by the frontend for balances, order book, or profile creation.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor with all logic in backend/main.mo; add backend/migration.mo only if required by persisted state changes.
Do not edit any files under frontend/src/components/ui or any paths listed as immutable in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Do not introduce third-party/external identity verification services (no KYC providers, no social API verification, no email/SMS verification).
nonGoals: Building a full real-world identity verification/KYC system.
Adding third-party authentication beyond Internet Identity.
Implementing new real-time communication features (chat, websockets, push notifications).
